intro: Lapageria rosea var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered tree of heaven, is a rare and striking plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae, characterized by its large, showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is known for its long, pendant-like flowers and its ability to thrive in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures. It has been cultivated for its ornamental value and is prized for its unique appearance and fragrance. Due to its limited natural range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in the wild.
